div.p: John Dow to Chairman, Public Service Board
B50459, unit 9, VPRS 619 Secretary's Correspondence Files, Alphabetical System, VA538 Department of Crown Lands and Survey, Public Record Office, Victoria.

A memorandum from the Secretary, Public Service Board, 27 July 1888, is attached to this letter, as follows: 'The enclosed papers in reference to the appointment of an Entomologist are forwarded to the Hon the Minister of Lands. The Board wishes to know if he desires to make any comments upon the reports of Baron Von Mueller and Professor McCoy.'
I concur with Baron Von Mueller and Professor McCoy that it wd be desirable to have one officer combining a knowledge of vegetable pathology with that of Entomology, but that does not seem practicable without going outside the service.

Of the two gentlemen under consideration I wd
would. be inclined to say Mr. French is the preferable applicant.
